text.text_translated: Asteroids are rocks in space. Some asteroids come near Earth. They can pass very close. The distance can be 7.5 million kilometres. This is near Earth's path around the Sun. NASA made a map of 1,400 of these asteroids. NASA says they are not dangerous in the next 100 years. With today's technology, NASA can track these space rocks. NASA can say if one might hit Earth. If that happens, they can use two ways to keep Earth safe.

feedback.feedback: FAIL: Factual Inaccuracy. The writer’s output replaces the specific term “Potentially Hazardous Asteroids” with the generic “Asteroids,” which changes the scope. Not all asteroids pass within 7.5 million kilometres of Earth’s orbit, so this is a core factual error.

best_attempt.text_translated:
An asteroid is a rock in space.
Some asteroids can come near Earth.
They can pass as close as 7.5 million kilometres from Earth.
We call these asteroids "maybe dangerous".
NASA made a map of 1,400 of these asteroids.
NASA says none will be a danger in the next 100 years.
With today's technology, NASA can track these objects.
They can say if one could hit Earth.
If that happens, they can use two ways to protect Earth.
